case_title: KAJIR AND 2 Other vs BARAN SHAH
case_number: Second Appeal from Order No. 16 of 1967
legal_issue: Interpretation of Section 45 of the Punjab Land Revenue Act, 1867

key_arguments.appellant: Section 45(1) is mandatory and requires prior permission from the Collector before filing a suit in civil court.
key_arguments.respondent: Section 45(1) is permissive and not mandatory, allowing suits to be filed directly in civil court.

court_findings.word_interpretation: The word 'may' in Section 45(1) does not mean 'must'.
court_findings.impact_of_fcr_withdrawal: The withdrawal of the Frontier Crimes Regulation rendered subsection (2) of Section 45 inoperative, leaving civil courts as the appropriate forum.

decision.reasoning: Section 45(1) was not mandatory, and the suits filed without prior permission were valid and maintainable.
decision.costs: Parties to bear their own costs.

cited_cases: Shamsuddin Ahmed v. Registrar, High Court of East Pakistan, Dacca (P L D 1967 S C 501)
Dad Muhammad Khan v. Bassa (P L D 1965 Lah. 77)
Sayed A.I Amir v. Dalmaa Cement Ltd. (P L D 1961 Kar. 255)
Muhammad Ismail and others v. The State (P L D 1969 S G 241)
